articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Famous Work Published in Mexico
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Famous Work Published in Mexico 
    Pyongyang, September 25 (KCNA) -- Leader Kim Jong Il's famous work "The Workers' Party of Korea Organizes and Guides All the Victories of Our People" was brought out in booklet by the Publishing House of the Workers' Party of Mexico on Sept. 19.
 The work published on October 3, Juche 79 (1990) clarifies the idea that the leadership of the party provides a sure guarantee for the victory in the cause of socialism, the issue of strengthening the WPK into a revolutionary party of Juche-type and basic ways of carrying out the mission and duty of the WPK as a leading political organization, etc.

articles.title: Information Bulletin Issued in Democratic Congo
WPK's Birthday to be Observed in Tanzania
articles.content:
WPK's Birthday to be Observed in Tanzania 
    Pyongyang, September 25 (KCNA) -- A Tanzanian national preparatory committee to celebrate the 60th anniversary of the Workers' Party of Korea was formed with due ceremony in Dar es Salaam on Sept. 17.
 At the ceremony Zakia Meghji, member of the National Executive Committee of the Revolutionary Party of Tanzania who is minister of Natural Resources and Tourism, was elected chairman of the preparatory committee.    
 The committee set the period from September 17 to October 17 as a celebration period and decided to hold colorful functions including a seminar, a lecture, a film show and a photo exhibition.

articles.title: DPRK to Closely Follow How U.S. Will Move at Phase of Action in Future
Repeal of SL Urged
articles.content:
Repeal of SL Urged 
    Pyongyang, September 25 (KCNA) -- The Student Committee of the Democratic Workers' Party of south Korea on Sept. 21 reportedly issued a statement titled "Dismantle Public Security and Investigation Team and Abolish National Security Law." 
 The statement said that the team under the Seoul district police office walked away Pak Ji Hyon, organizational director of the Student Committee of the Democratic Workers' Party, on charges of violating the notorious NSL on Sept. 21.
 The designation of the south Korean Federation of University Student Councils as "enemy-benefiting", whereby more than 1,000 students had been arrested for the mere reason that they were student representatives, has been jeered by the whole world, the statement said.    
 The whole nation in the south and the north is forming a great irresistible trend of independent reunification, the statement noted, adding that the NSL which protects the power of pro-U.S. forces is no more than an evil law nobody recognizes.
 We, youth and students, will deal a final heavy blow at the NSL with the indignation of today, the statement stressed.

Greetings to President of Yemen
articles.content:
Greetings to President of Yemen 
    Pyongyang, September 25 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Sunday sent a message of greetings to President of Yemen Ali Abdullah Saleh on the occasion of the 43rd anniversary of the revolutionary day of Yemen.
 Expressing conviction that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would continue to develop in the future, too, the message sincerely wished the president greater success in his work for the prosperity of the country.

articles.title: Struggle of WPK and Korean People Supported
articles.content:
Struggle of WPK and Korean People Supported
    Pyongyang, September 24 (KCNA) -- The chairman of the Liberal Party of Brazil when meeting with Pak Hyok, DPRK ambassador to Brazil, who paid a courtesy call on him on Sept. 15, expressed full support and solidarity with the Workers' Party and people of Korea in their struggle to achieve the independent and peaceful reunification of the country on the principle of national independence without any interference of outsiders.
 Warmly congratulating the Korean people on the 60th anniversary of the WPK, the chairman said that he was pleased to have and develop fresh relations with the WPK with long history and tradition.    
 He said that he is watching with deep concern the struggle of the Korean people who are speeding up the building of a great prosperous powerful socialist nation under the Songun leadership of Kim Jong Il.

GNP's Acts of Treachery under Fire
articles.content:
GNP's Acts of Treachery under Fire
    Pyongyang, September 24 (KCNA) -- The Korean nation desirous of national reconciliation and unity, peace and reunification will never pardon such acts of treachery of the Grand National Party of south Korea as anti-reunification acts and its moves for confrontation and war as it regards flunkeyism and dependence on outside forces as its means of living.
 Rodong Sinmun today says this in a by-lined article. It goes on:
 The GNP, a wicked group of sycophantic traitors, has closely cooperated with outside aggressor forces and perpetrated the above-mentioned crimes, refusing to face up to the reality and clinging to their coattails despite the advance of the June 15 era of reunification.    
 The GNP clan greedy for power is keen to prolong their remaining days of their political careers in reliance upon flunkeyism and dependence on outside forces without an iota of independence. They do not bother to commit such acts of treachery as cooperating with the U.S. in the pursuance of its hostile policy towards the north, blindly dancing to its tune.  They are so blinded with flunkeyism towards the U.S. and anti-reunification acts and confrontation with the north that they are zealously patronizing and backing its policy of war of aggression aimed at doing harm to the fellow countrymen and threatening the peace of the country and the security of the nation and playing the role as a shock brigade for implementing it.
 The GNP is desperately working to boost the anachronistic war "alliance" with the U.S.
 Whoever truly stands for the peace and the reunification of the country should decisively come out against the anachronistic and treacherous "alliance" with the U.S. 
 The desperate efforts on the part of the GNP clan to preserve the "alliance" with outside forces, setting store by it, while antagonizing the fellow countrymen, are aimed at strangulating them by force of arms in collusion with outside forces and realizing their ambition to unify the country by invading the north.    
This is an anti-national action intolerable in the June 15 era of reunification.
 The GNP is fanning up an atmosphere of war against the north, dead-set against the U.S. troop pullback from south Korea.    
 The 60 year-long history of national division clearly proves that as long as the U.S. forces are present in south Korea, the clouds of war cannot be removed from the sky of the Korean Peninsula and Koreans will never be safe and peace and the cause of peaceful reunification of the country will encounter repeated challenges. 
 The U.S. imperialist forces of aggression in south Korea are lording it over in south Korea, frantically pursuing their moves for a war against the north and escalating the military confrontation and tension. This would be unthinkable without the treacherous and anti-reunification reckless acts being perpetrated by the GNP, while begging for the permanent presence of the U.S. forces of aggression in south Korea.
 In the case the GNP, a war servant of the U.S., is allowed to come to power, the history of confrontation between the north and the south will repeat itself and the disaster of a nuclear war will be imposed on the Korean nation in the end.

articles.title: Joint Slogans Serve as Banner of Socialist Cause: Rodong Sinmun
Member of House of Lords of UK and His Party Arrive
articles.content:
Member of House of Lords of UK and His Party Arrive
    Pyongyang, September 24 (KCNA) -- Member of the House of Lords Guthrie, former chief of the General Staff of the British army, and his party arrived here today.
 They were greeted at the airport by Ri Jong Hyok, deputy to the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly who is chairman of the DPRK-Britain Friendship Parliamentary Group, and a staff member of the British embassy here.

articles.title: Visits
articles.content:
Visits
    Pyongyang, September 24 (KCNA) -- A DPRK friendship delegation headed by Minister of Finance Mun Il Bong who is chairman of the Korea-Mongolia Friendship Association left here today to visit Mongolia and a delegation of the Ministry of Land and Environment Preservation headed by Vice-Minister Kim Kyong Jun also left here for China.
 Arriving here Saturday was a delegation of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of South Africa led by Deputy Minister Aziz Goolam Hoosein Pahad.
